Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery kernos with part of one vessel holder; white slip; interior of vessel holder has reserved band around inner edge of stem, the rest glazed black with traces of added red and added white decoration, probably rosettes; exterior: on front of neck, tongue pattern between pairs of black bands; back of neck reserved; interior of kernos: two bands above trace of maeander pattern; on top: to left of vessel holder, part of rosette with red in centre; at right of vessel holder, black-figure decoration consisting of front part of lion (red on forehead, mane and belly) to left; incised pendant and rising rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; exterior: part of sphinx to left (trace of head, wing, hindquarters and tail remaining; red on hair) and upper part of centaur to right with left arm raised in front, holding branches depicted above his back (red on hair and beard and incised flecks on torso and arm); pendant rosettes with red centres as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 321, no. 1440, pl. 191)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VI, no. 29)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 141, no. 844, pl. 97)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2190) (phase 2)
